title: 'TalkTalk has left me unable to talk to anyone for months'
text:

Sat, Jul 11, 2015, 12:05 BST - UK Markets closed 'TalkTalk has left me unable to talk to anyone for months' By Jessica Gorst-Williams | Telegraph – 2 hours 5 minutes ago Print 
A small business owner is left without a telephone or broadband service after moving home 
I arranged with TalkTalk more than two months ago for my phone and broadband to be moved to my new address. Despite a new pole being erected in the drive within a week and a cable being run to the outside of our property we still don’t have the services. 
I have rung TalkTalk more than 12 times and the call centre has promised to escalate the matter. It has given me three different dates when an engineer will call. No one has arrived. 
I run my own building company and have spent extra money on mobile phone calls and internet charges in order to keep contact with my business. BF, Worcs 
Soon after I spoke to TalkTalk your telecommunications were, at last, reconnected. 
TalkTalk tells me your situation demonstrates the pitfalls of depending on a residential account while running a business from the premises. It says that, in such circumstances, it prioritises business accounts which have a better service level agreement. 
You naturally remain disillusioned and are considering moving to another provider at the end of your contract. To say sorry, TalkTalk has provided three months’ free internet access and calls.
